sn6.12:1.2: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Rājagaha on Mount Vulture Peak not long after Devadatta had left.
sn6.12:1.3: Then, when the night had advanced, Brahmā Sahampati, of stunning beauty, illuminating the entire Mount Vulture Peak, approached the Blessed One, paid homage to him, and stood to one side.
sn6.12:1.4: Standing to one side, referring to Devadatta, he recited this verse in the presence of the Blessed One:
sn6.12:2.2: To the plantain, bamboo, and reed,
sn6.12:2.3: So do honours destroy the scoundrel,
sn6.12:2.4: As its embryo destroys the mule.”
